alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a piperazine ring where the nitrogen ring atom carries an aryl group.
alternative_parents.name: N-arylpiperazines

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds that contain a phenol ether, which carries an amine group on the benzene ring.
alternative_parents.name: Aminophenyl ethers

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds contaning a phenoxy group.
alternative_parents.name: Phenoxy compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an aminobenzene moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Aniline and substituted anilines

alternative_parents.description: Aliphatic aromatic amines in which the amino group is linked to two aliphatic chains and one aromatic group.
alternative_parents.name: Dialkylarylamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a benzene with exactly two chlorine atoms attached to it.
alternative_parents.name: Dichlorobenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl aryl ether functional group with the generic formula R-O-R' , where R is an alkyl group and R' is an aryl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl aryl ethers

alternative_parents.description: Acetals derived from ketones by replacement of the oxo group by two hydrocarbyloxy groups R2C(OR)2 ( R not Hydrogen ). This term, once abandoned, has been reinstated as a subclass of acetals.
alternative_parents.name: Ketals

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acyl chloride functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl chlorides

alternative_parents.description: Heterocyclic compounds containing an imidazole ring substituted at position 1.
alternative_parents.name: N-substituted imidazoles

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing 1,3-dioxolane, an aliphatic five-member ring with two oxygen atoms in ring positions 1 and 3.
alternative_parents.name: 1,3-dioxolanes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds with the general formula RNHC(=O)CH3, where R= organyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Acetamides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an amide derivative of carboxylic acid, with the general structure RN(R1)C(R2)=O (R1-R2 any atom but H).
alternative_parents.name: Tertiary carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an amine group, a carboxylic acid group (or a derivative thereof), and a side-chain that is specific to each amino acid.
alternative_parents.name: Amino acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Organic compounds containing diazinane, a six-membered saturated heterocycle containing four carbon atoms and two nitrogen atoms.
class.name: Diazinanes

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenylpiperazines. These are compounds containing a phenylpiperazine skeleton, which consists of a piperazine bound to a phenyl group.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing a phenylpiperazine skeleton, which consists of a piperazine bound to a phenyl group.
direct_parent.name: Phenylpiperazines

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds containing a piperazine ring, which is a saturated aliphatic six-member heterocyclic with two nitrogen atoms at positions 1 and 4, as well as four carbon atoms.
subclass.name: Piperazines

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
